item.title: Leland add a quote by James Tate
item.description: "Jesus got up one day a little later than usual. He had been dreaming so deep there was nothing left in his head. What was it? A nightmare, dead bodies walking all around him, eyes rolled back, skin falling off. But he wasn't afraid of that. It was a beautiful day. How 'bout some coffee? Don't mind if I do. Take a little ride on my donkey, I love that donkey. Hell, I love everybody." -- James Tate

item.title: Leland add a quote by James Tate
item.description: "I couldn’t even picture Mavis’s face anymore. It was sad. She was being erased. I wanted to put my finger on her forehead, but there was nothing there." -- James Tate

item.title: Leland add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "What a bog and labyrinth the human essence is... We are all overbrained and overemotioned." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Leland add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "The point is to strip down, get protestant, then even more naked. Walk over scorched bricks to find your own soul. Your heart a searching dog in the rubble." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Leland add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "I looked over the despondency of the home crowd. Fools! Fools! I thought. Love it! Love the loss as well as the gain. Go home and dig it. Nobody was killed. We saw victory and defeat, and they were both wonderful." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Leland add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "You've got to lie to stay halfway interested in yourself." -- Barry Hannah

item.title: Leland add a quote by Barry Hannah
item.description: "Where is the angry machine of all of us? Why is God such a blurred magician? Why are you begging for your life if you believe those things? Prove to me that you’re better than the rabbits we ate last night." -- Barry Hannah
